text: A city alive at all hours...
The hum of tricycles, the chatter of sari-sari stores, and the distant echo of karaoke drift through the humid night air.
But when the lights dim and the streets fall quiet, it is not the police who first respond.
In the barangays, peace rests in the hands of the vigilant.
Men and women who patrol not for glory, but for their neighbors.
One of them was Leo Mendoza...
A 19-year-old tanod trainee, eager and idealistic.
He dreamed not of riches, but of becoming a shield for his community.
His friends teased him for working nights, yet his smile never wavered.
Every evening, he strapped on his vest, carried his small notebook, and promised himself he would make a difference.
Tonight was no different... or so it seemed.
Leo steps into the night, unaware of the danger waiting at the corner of the street.
Shadows shift between alleys, whispers scatter like rats fleeing the light.
For Leo, duty came first. But for others, silence was a weapon.
The streets are silent once again...
And by dawn, the city will awaken to a tragedy that cannot be ignored.
